0: A man burned down his parents’ home, killing their three pets after he lit wooden matches to exterminate ants in the basement, Maine's state fire marshal said. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Devon Doucette tried to get rid of the ants by incinerating them, but instead ignited combustible materials, which sparked a fire that spread quickly in the Old Orchard Beach home, authorities said. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The family’s two cats and one dog died in the fire, officials said, adding that no charges are expected against Doucette. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The 21-year-old was treated for smoke inhalation and burns after he carried burning items outside from the home, officials said. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Tapestries damaged in 2001 fire return to Manhattan cathedral NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The man's parents, who own the home, were not home when the blaze broke out. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR A GoFundMe page set up for the family to help pay for their expenses has raised more than $11,400 of its $10,000 goal as of Tuesday afternoon. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR “This family is just now starting on their long road on trying to get their life back,” the page reads. “So many of us are hurting for them as no one deserves to lose everything.”
